text: kepler-452b sits right in the habitable
zone what we call the Goldilocks zone
not too warm not too cold not too bright
not too dark just right for life
excitement mounts when further analysis
rebuilds 452b could have a potentially
breathable atmosphere with those
temperatures in that atmosphere could
actually be suitable for liquid water on
the surface and when scientists factor
in the light from kepler-452b comes
clear that this is the most earth-like
world humanity has ever discovered the
light from parent star is much like the
light from our own star has the same
mixture of colors so photosynthesis of
plants like the ones here on earth will
probably be just fine you could probably
take a plant from Earth move it to that
planet and it would grow just fine
plantlife means that there could be
oxygen oxygen means that there could be
life like ours the incredible
combination of liquid water light and
temperatures suitable for life inspires
NASA to give planet kepler-452b a new
name earth 2.0 this news is electrifying
when NASA is calling something earth 2.0
you know is something big kepler-452b is
the closest we have to anything like
Earth yet astonishingly this world could
provide a glimpse of our own future
kepler 452b orbits around a star very
similar to our Sun but it's a billion
and a half years older than ours it is
sending out 10% more heat than it did a
billion and a half years ago if it was
the same age as our Sun to us this world
at this point might almost look like the
Sahara Desert
kepler-452b is 1,400 light-years away
we're not going there anytime soon if
ever and as far as life on that planet
might be concerned well it's just going
to remain a mystery for
